result.execSummary:
The defendant John M Casey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $268 + $250 DNA surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample. Successful completion of Drug Court.

Status conference on February 2, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

CASH BAIL TO REVERT TO SIGNATURE BOND IF CO-SIGNED BY JILL CASEY OR REASONABLY CONSISTENT SPELLING OF THAT NAME ON THE CO-SIGNERS I.D.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not be within one block of Meadowridge Library in Madison, WI.
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 9 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail or the bond is co-signed by Jill Casey, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
